text: The Prelude in E Minor, Op. 28 No. 4 is a Prelude written by Frederic Chopin in his set of 23 Preludes. It is known to have been completed by January 1839. In comparison to his other works, it is technically simple, consisting of a melody over a pulse of chords in the left hand. Category:Compositions by Frédéric Chopin Category:Solo piano pieces Category:Compositions in E minor
title: Prelude in E Minor (Chopin)
